alert.note: Alert for Eastern Essex; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 6:34AM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Northumberland, Richmond, Westmoreland and central Essex Counties through 715 AM EDT... At 634 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Montross, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Warsaw around 650 AM EDT. Hague around 700 AM EDT. Haynesville around 710 AM EDT. Kinsale and Farnham around 715 AM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Currioman Landing, Threeway, Mount Holly, Stratford Hall, Tidewater, Lyells, Kennard, Westmoreland, Erica and Piney Grove. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Essex; Northumberland; Richmond; Western Essex; Westmoreland
